items.title: Apeiros
items.description:
Apeiros is a digital whiteboard app I worked on to help teams and clients brainstorm ideas together online. It's designed to be user-friendly, letting everyone throw ideas around and sketch out concepts. Working on this project, I focused on creating the structure and making the canvas feel smooth and keeping the app running fast, no matter how many ideas were flying around. It was a great experience figuring out how to build something that could bring people's creative processes together, even when they're miles apart.

The most challenging part of developing Apeiros was definitely getting the geometry right. Working with shapes and making sure everything aligned perfectly on the canvas required a lot of precision and testing. But in the end, I got better at geometry too.

items.title: Person Alarm
items.description: For a class project at university, I built something called Person Alarm. It’s basically a camera that keeps an eye on risky areas. Using an ESP32-CAM and Python (open cv, yolo v3, django), it watches for anyone approaching where they shouldn’t be. When it detects movement, it snaps a photo and checks if there’s a person in it. If there is, it quickly sends an alert to my phone. It was a fun challenge mixing electronics with code.

items.title: Umitde.com
items.description:
I built my personal website using SvelteKit, mainly to keep all my blog posts in one spot and show my works. It’s a simple, clean site where I can share my thoughts. It was fun learning more about SvelteKit.

I also designed it by myself because of the several reasons. Feel free to use. It's open source!

items.title: Hierapi
items.description: Hierapi was a multi language e-commerce website I developed from scratch for a company that is based in Turkey. It was my first freelance job and it took almost 6 months to complete. I coded it with Django and Vue js.

items.title: Petra Coffee
items.description: I designed a website for Petra Coffee (based in Turkey) using shopify.

items.title: Mimic Robot
items.description: In high school, I helped creating a project called Mimic Robot for a TÜBİTAK competition. It's a robot made from wood, using an Arduino and a Windows Kinect camera to copy human gestures.

items.title: Smile Mirror
items.description: For a high school project at a TÜBİTAK competition, I worked on a project called Smile Mirror. It’s a mirror that takes a selfie when you smile. I built it with c++ and open cv to recognize smiles and automatically capture photos

items.title: Spor Istanbul CLI
items.description: The GYM I go to requires booking spots three days ahead. Manually checking availability makes me sick, and forgetting to do so often leads to missed workouts. So I've built a CLI app with Golang to automate this process. It checks the empty spot periodically and whenever it finds an empty spot, plays an alarm to warn me.
